Name: valid_config
Check: Hub config valid

Name: submission_time
Check: Current time within file submission window

Name: file_exists
Check: File exists at `file_path` provided

Name: file_name
Check: File name valid

Name: file_location
Check: File located in correct team directory

Name: round_id_valid
Check: File round ID is valid hub round IDs

Name: file_format
Check: File format is accepted hub/round format

Name: metadata_exists
Check: Model metadata file exists in expected location

Name: file_read
Check: File can be read without errors

Name: valid_round_id_col
Check: Round ID var from config exists in data column names. Skipped if `round_id_from_var` is FALSE in config.

Name: unique_round_id
Check: Round ID column contains a single unique round ID. Skipped if `round_id_from_var` is FALSE in config.

Name: match_round_id
Check: Round ID from file contents matches round ID from file name. Skipped if `round_id_from_var` is FALSE in config.

Name: colnames
Check: File column names match expected column names for round (i.e. task ID names + hub standard column names)

Name: col_types
Check: File column types match expected column types from config. Mainly applicable to parquet & arrow files.

Name: valid_vals
Check: Columns (excluding `value` column) contain valid combinations of task ID / output type / output type ID values
Extra info: error_tbl: table of invalid task ID/output type/output type ID value combinations

Name: rows_unique
Check: Columns (excluding `value` column) contain unique combinations of task ID / output type / output type ID values

Name: req_vals
Check: Columns (excluding `value` column) contain all required combinations of task ID / output type / output type ID values
Extra info: missing_df: table of missing task ID/output type/output type ID value combinations

Name: value_col_valid
Check: Values in `value` column are coercible to data type configured for each output type

Name: value_col_non_desc
Check: Values in `value` column are non-decreasing as output_type_ids increase for all unique task ID /output type value combinations. Applies to `quantile` or `cdf` output types only

Name: value_col_sum1
Check: Values in the `value` column of `pmf` output type data for each unique task ID combination sum to 1.

Name: spl_compound_tid
Check: Samples contain single unique values for each compound task ID within individual samples (v3 and above schema only).
Extra info: errors: list containing item for each sample failing validation with breakdown of unique values for each compound task ID.

Name: spl_non_compound_tid
Check: Samples contain single unique combination of non-compound task ID values across all samples (v3 and above schema only).
Extra info:
errors: list containing item for each modeling task with vectors of output type ids of samples failing validation and example table of most frequent non-compound task ID value combination
across all samples in the modeling task.

Name: spl_n
Check: Number of samples for a given compound idx falls within accepted compound task range (v3 and above schema only).
Extra info:
errors: list containing item for each compound_idx failing validation with sample count, metadata on expected samples and example table of expected structure for samples belonging to
the compound idx in question.

Name: metadata_schema_exists
Check: A model metadata schema file exists in `hub-config` directory.

Name: metadata_file_exists
Check: A file with name provided to argument `file_path` exists at the expected location (the `model-metadata` directory).

Name: metadata_file_ext
Check: The metadata file has correct extension (yaml or yml).

Name: metadata_file_location
Check: The metadata file has been saved to correct location.

Name: metadata_matches_schema
Check: The contents of the metadata file match the hub's model metadata schema

Name: metadata_file_name
Check: The metadata filename matches the model ID specified in the contents of the file.

Name: NA
Check: The number of metadata files submitted by a single team does not exceed the maximum number allowed.

Name: NA
Check: Time difference between values in two date columns equal a defined period.

Name: NA
Check: Predicted values per location are less than total location population.

Name: NA
Check: Time difference between values in two date columns equals a defined time period defined by values in a horizon column.
